about.description: Orbit is a Python package for Bayesian time series forecasting and inference. It provides a familiar and intuitive initialize-fit-predict interface for time series tasks, while utilizing probabilistic programming languages under the hood. For details, check out our documentation and tutorials: - HTML (stable): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ - HTML (latest): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ Currently, it supports concrete implementations for the following models: - Exponential Smoothing (ETS) - Local Global Trend (LGT) - Damped Local Trend (DLT) - Kernel Time-based Regression (KTR) It also supports the following sampling/optimization methods for model estimation/inferences: - Markov-Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) as a full sampling method - Maximum a Posteriori (MAP) as a point estimate method - Variational Inference (VI) as a hybrid-sampling method on approximate distribution PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/](https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/)
about.summary: Orbit is a package for bayesian time series modeling and inference.

raw_meta_yaml: {% set name = "orbit-ml" %} {% set version = "1.1.4.2" %} package: name: {{ name|lower }} version: {{ version }} source: url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/orbit-ml-{{ version }}.tar.gz sha256: 5843f7748036f39bb4d95af07aadca5e8a2f5f2de6f5eda16cf4a73ad8cc3bb3 build: number: 0 noarch: python script: - TBB_CXX_TYPE=gcc - python -c "import sys; print(sys.version)" - {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv # entry_points: # - install_cmdstan = cmdstanpy.install_cmdstan:main # - install_cxx_toolchain = cmdstanpy.install_cxx_toolchain:main requirements: host: - pip - pytest - python >=3.7, <= 3.9 - numpy >=1.18.2 - cmdstanpy >=1.0.4 run: - python >=3.7 - numpy >=1.18 - pandas >=1.0.3 - matplotlib-base >=3.3.2 - scipy >=1.4.1 - pytorch >=1.11.0 - cmdstanpy >=1.0.4 - pyro-ppl >=1.4.0 - seaborn >=0.10.0 - statsmodels >=0.11.1 - arviz - tqdm >=4.36.1 test: imports: - orbit - orbit.constants commands: - pip check requires: - pip about: home: https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ summary: Orbit is a package for bayesian time series modeling and inference. license: Apache-2.0 license_file: LICENSE description: | Orbit is a Python package for Bayesian time series forecasting and inference. It provides a familiar and intuitive initialize-fit-predict interface for time series tasks, while utilizing probabilistic programming languages under the hood. For details, check out our documentation and tutorials: - HTML (stable): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ - HTML (latest): https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ Currently, it supports concrete implementations for the following models: - Exponential Smoothing (ETS) - Local Global Trend (LGT) - Damped Local Trend (DLT) - Kernel Time-based Regression (KTR) It also supports the following sampling/optimization methods for model estimation/inferences: - Markov-Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) as a full sampling method - Maximum a Posteriori (MAP) as a point estimate method - Variational Inference (VI) as a hybrid-sampling method on approximate distribution PyPI: [https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/](https://pypi.org/project/orbit-ml/) doc_url: https://orbit-ml.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ dev_url: https://github.com/uber/orbit extra: recipe-maintainers: - edwinnglabs - sugatoray # maintainers from upstream repository - edwinnglabs
